Reviews.Title: Excellent Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Chinaski
Reviews.Content: After looking online and going to all the baby stores I finally found a really amazing camera, the set up took about 3 minutes (download the software online do not try to insert the mini CD in your laptop!), it works on my Mac, the image quality is great especially at night, the sound is not too bad, enough to hear a baby cry but you will still hear some static. compared with other cameras I have tried, Foscam and the IBaby this camera is really well made, no plastic part, long power cords, very small and easy to hide.Update a few month later: The static has gotten worse and the camera keeps disconnecting from the network every now and then, I am returning the camera and Y-cam is sending a new one

Reviews.Title: Wonderful  and  Cute  Product
Reviews.Author: gary
Reviews.Content: Really pleased with this camera and is perfect for what I needed it for, watching my back door.  I needed to customize motion detection and I really liked the multiple window set-up and that I can set up sensitivity. Good image quality and very helpful team when I had a few questions to ask. Good job y-cam.

Reviews.Title: Works, but not ideal.
Reviews.Author: J. Stimson
Reviews.Content: The first unit I received was defective (it rebooted every 2-3 minutes, and sometimes would fail to reconnect to the network).The second unit works pretty reliably.  It is nice to be able to view it in a web browser on either a mobile device or a PC.The camera fails to meet the ideal in the following ways:Occasionally (every 5-10 minutes) the video pauses.  In a browser window, a refresh is required to restart it.  In the dedicated MultiLive PC software, the video restarts automatically.The MultiLive PC software periodically locks up, and will not restart without killing the old process from the Windows task manager.Even at the highest quality setting, the picture is pretty pixelated for a 640x480 image.  Frame rate does not seem to be 30fps as advertised.The audio feed has a constant background tickety-tickety-tickety...The infrared lamps emit visible red light, which makes the camera visible in the dark.Changing any of the night vision settings causes a clicking sound from the camera.  Changing the IR filter setting causes a loud click which attracts attention.Automatic IP setting did not work.  I had to assign the IP address manually.UPDATE: After 3 months of continuous use indoors, the replacement unit started freezing up (not responding to the network) about once a day, recoverable only by disconnecting and reconnecting power.  Y-Cam replaced it under warranty (I paid to ship the bad unit to them).  The new camera has new firmware and I was able to use automatic IP address assignment (DHCP).

Reviews.Title: Audio failed after a week
Reviews.Author: Palmer Stephens
Reviews.Content: We have a Y-cam Knight we use to monitor a baby and it worked great for 2 years.  Then it began to quit working at random times so we decided to upgrade to the Y-cam cube.  While smaller, I have not been impressed with quality, especially for a $200 cam.Also Y-cam has quit updating their multilive software for viewing the cam and the other vendors they recommend such IP Viewer didn't play audio.A a former Y-cam fan who suggested them to many other parents we are switching to Dropcam.
